Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Cloud Computing Helps Companies Weather Economic Turmoil

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Stephen Schmidt, Chief Information Security Officer, AWS
additionalFields.description:
The role of CISOs is to help guide the board and their peer C-suite leaders as they proactively protect their brands and customers. Today, security demands a new focus on software, and technology leaders have to be deeply involved in software development and investments. At the same time, security teams also require different skills and mindsets to succeed in new domains. AWS CISO Stephen Schmidt shares three behaviors of security leaders that recognize that security leadership is a collective pursuit. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Cultivating Security Leadership

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Stephen Orban, General Manager, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Leaders lead in many different ways. Some lead by fear, some by example, some with charisma, and some lead through others. And while every leader’s style is slightly different, people are most likely to follow those they understand. Stephen Orban, General Manager at AWS, shares his perspective on what separates the great leaders from the good ones.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: What Makes Good Leaders Great?

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
In the digital world, we are willing to be surprised and to learn. In the old days, we relied on a plan, prepared in advance, to guide our activities. But in a world dominated by uncertainty, in a world in which none of us knows all there is to know about our customers or about what will change in our competitive or regulatory environment, how can someone presume to develop a plan that will deliver business value? AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz shares his thoughts on why humility is the essence of digital transformation.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Humility

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
When it comes to digital transformation, every enterprise is different. There is often a change agent with a vision, a knowledge of good practices, a sense of urgency, and the energy to battle impediments. The change agent may be anywhere in the organizational structure: high, low, or—in a typical scenario—somewhere in middle management. AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz discusses why change that is driven from the top of the organization is a particular type of change requiring a particular approach.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Driving Change From the Top Down

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Angie Ruan, SVP Global Technology, Nasdaq
additionalFields.description:
Nasdaq is a leading global provider of trading, clearing, technology, listing, information, and public company services. Through its diverse portfolio of solutions, Nasdaq enables customers to plan, optimize, and execute their business vision with confidence, using proven technologies that provide transparency and insight for navigating today’s global capital markets. We connected with Angie Ruan, Senior Vice President of Global Technology at Nasdaq, to get her thoughts on the convergence of technology and financial services, and what she's learned from leading digital transformation for highly regulated industries.  

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Bridging two industries

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Bowen Wang, Cloud Financial Management Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
As businesses undergo digital transformation to keep up with the ever-quickening pace of innovation customers expect, technology and finance leaders are adapting financial management processes and rethinking the way you manage technology. This guide shares Amazon Web Services (AWS) perspectives on why digital transformation requires a shift and evolution in financial management processes, how organizations can adapt, and what AWS solutions can help you succeed and manage technology as a business.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: AWS Cloud Financial Management Guide

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mattia Gamberoni, Head of Enterprise, AWS Iberia
additionalFields.description:
With organizations’ need for faster, data-driven decision making to adapt and meet customer needs, establishing a strategy to unleash your organizations data is even more pressing. Mattia Gamberoni, Head of Enterprise at AWS Iberia, discusses those organizations across Iberia that are leading the way and common challenges to look out for.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: How Iberian Organizations are Becoming Data-driven

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Gerald Boyne, Head of Security Assurance, AWS DACH region
additionalFields.description:
Security is at the top of nearly every German organization's agenda. Gerald Boyne, Head of Security Assurance, explores how embedding security practices into the culture of your organization can help avoid the financial or operational drain - and turn it into an organizational enabler instead.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: How German Organizations can Turn Security into an Enabler

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Klaus Bürg, Managing Director & General Manager, AWS DACH region
additionalFields.description:
Businesses across industries in Germany, Austria and Switzerland (DACH) have been challenged by reducing profit margins for some time. CEOs can unlock revenue growth by driving increasingly customer-focused cultures in their enterprises, empowered by agile technologies. Here Klaus Berg explores key challenges in the DACH region and best leadership practices for establishing lasting and profitable change, while mitigating the risks.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Customer-centricity: How it can help organizations across DACH thrive

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miguel Alava, Managing Director, AWS Iberia
additionalFields.description:
With organizations across Iberia lagging behind their European and Global peers in Digital Transformation, Miguel Alava, Managing Director of AWS Iberia, explores the expanding role of the CIO, why it’s critical for Iberian CIOs to lead their organizations transformation, and best practices from those organizations successfully transforming.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Why CIOs should be Leading the Digital Transformation of Iberian Organizations

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Sylvie Houlière Mayca, Head of Sales, AWS France
additionalFields.description:
At this time of disruption, many business leaders are working to accelerate technology transformation within their organisations in order to create efficiencies and deliver new business value. But, across France, executives have found that change initiatives are stalling and the benefits are too slow to materialise. So what can boards do in response to this? Sylvie Houlière Mayca, Head of Sales for AWS France, explains four key cultural strategies for change with lasting impact.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: How French Leaders Can Address the Cultural Challenges of Transformation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Philip Potloff, Head of Enterprise Strategy, AWS
additionalFields.description:
IT is no longer viewed just as a provider of services, with technology leaders increasingly being called upon to play a central role in the creation of new business value. Yet most enterprise IT organizations are laden with technical debt and are not as agile as they would like to be. In this ebook, learn how leaders are using the cloud and effective patterns for IT to move their companies from a low-frequency rate of change to a higher-frequency pace, reducing the risk of change and creating a flywheel for more frequent value delivery. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Tuning Up the High-Frequency Enterprise

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Florian Hartwig, Head of Enterprise, AWS Germany
additionalFields.description:
With the global weight of AI powerhouses pressing down, Germany can’t afford to stay still. Florian Hartwig, Head of Enterprise, explores why it’s critical for German corporations to lay the foundation for a strong data strategy and be front and center of the digital revolution.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: German Organizations Must be Front and Center of the Digital Revolution

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Jonathan Allen and Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Leading financial services institutions are embracing cloud to both solve infrastructure needs in new ways, and create new experiences customers love. In this eBook, industry leaders share how they are navigating the technology and the organizational changes required. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Cloud Era of Financial Services

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Yvonne Bettkober, General Manager, AWS Switzerland
additionalFields.description:
Digital transformation is crucial if companies are to evolve their products and services to meet the ever-increasing expectations of today’s customer. Yet in Switzerland, there is a concern that increasing the speed and flexibility of innovation will impact quality. To answer this, Yvonne Bettkober, General Manager of AWS Switzerland, explores how successful Swiss firms are finding the right balance.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Swiss Firms Must Take a Principled Approach to Innovation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Sylvie Houlière Mayca, Head of Sales, AWS France
additionalFields.description:
The skills gap in the French digital workforce is only increasing. Sylvie Houlière Mayca, Head of Sales, AWS France, discusses how the richest, yet often overlooked, talent pool in most French organizations is the one they already have, and examines how existing talent can be cultivated into the talent needed to digitally transform.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: French Organizations Need to Cultivate the Talent Within

additionalFields.subHeadline: with Hanno Blankenstein, CEO, Unleash Live
additionalFields.description:
Hanno Blankenstein, the CEO of Unleash Live, sits down with Jake Burns, an Enterprise Strategist for AWS, to talk about how Unleash Live innovates and responds to change quickly. Hanno shares his views on hiring and developing talent while creating an inspirational and innovative culture.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Innovation and Inspiration

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Mark Schwartz, AWS Enterprise Strategist, and Paul Hannan, UK Enterprise Technology Lead, share their top tips for navigating a successful cloud transformation. Based on their experience coaching enterprises through diverse cloud adoption and transformation journeys, Mark and Paul discuss the importance of trusting your people and adapting your culture. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: A Leader's Guide to Cloud Transformation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Ian Massingham, Director of Developer Technology & Evangelism, AWS Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA)
additionalFields.description:
With the growing need for robust security practices, Ian Massingham, Director of Developer Technology & Evangelism, explores how UK companies ‘creating a culture of security’ are often better placed to innovate and adapt to disruption. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Securing UK Companies for the Future

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Jonathan Allen, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
In this ebook, AWS Enterprise Strategist Jonathan Allen describes how you can put together a leadership team with the skills and autonomy needed to drive your transformation, guided by a clear strategic vision. Once the leadership team is on the same page, you can start on skilling up your engineering teams across the business.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Supercharge Your Skills for Cloud Success

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
As more and more enterprise executives embrace migration to the cloud, some wonder if their current IT employee base is holding them back from realizing its full potential. However, having this gap is not an insurmountable problem. Your employees already have invaluable knowledge about the company and its products, and technology employees tend to be fast, flexible, and eager learners. As AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz explains, the real question is how to take advantage of your employee's wealth of knowledge as company insiders by helping them leverage their existing technical skills to learn critical new ones.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Staying Competitive by Investing in Cloud Skills

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Darren Hardman, VP and General Manager, AWS UK and Ireland
additionalFields.description:
The UK has long prided itself on offering companies a fertile business environment to encourage innovation. Between changing customer habits and the widespread disruption of 2020, that innovation must now be focused on finding ways to understand the changing needs of customers and responding faster than ever. Darren Hardman, VP, General Manager, UK and Ireland for AWS, offers his views on why UK CEOs must increase their focus on innovation to weather disruption and ensure future competitive advantage. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: UK CEOs Must Lead From the Front on Innovation

additionalFields.subHeadline: Strategies for maintaining robust security and regulatory compliance
additionalFields.description:
As with everything at Amazon, the success of our security and compliance program is primarily measured by one thing: our customers’ success. Our customers’ requirements drive our portfolio of compliance reports, attestations, and certifications that enable our customers to run a secure and compliant cloud environment. This guide provides a comprehensive but high-level overview of how AWS can help your organization achieve savings and scalability while still maintaining robust security and regulatory compliance. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Security and Compliance Quick Reference Guide

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Phil Le-Brun, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
All too often the business value of digital transformation is not realised. One on the most common causes is that many are treated as technology projects first, rather than the business culture transformations they actually are. AWS Enterprise Strategist, Phil Le-Brun, explores three habits of successful transformation. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Digital Transformation: Lead with Culture, Enable with Technology

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Darren Hardman, VP and General Manager, AWS UK and Ireland
additionalFields.description:
Innovation is critical, whether organisations are looking to reduce costs, optimise, or grow. Whether re-imagining business processes for efficiency and cost saving, or developing new products, services, or business models, it really comes down to creating business value. Darren Hardman, VP & General Manager of AWS UK and Ireland explores how UK businesses overcome barriers to innovation, and celebrates four British organisations pushing boundaries and embracing innovation to deliver novel customer experience and value. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Great Innovations in British Business: Four Examples from AWS

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miguel Alava, Managing Director, AWS Iberia
additionalFields.description:
Many organizations in Iberia attributing their lagging digital maturity to an IT talent gap. Miguel Alava, Managing Director of AWS Iberia, discusses how investing in training and re-skilling your existing workforce can offer much greater benefit that most organizations realize.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: A Talent Gap Doesn’t Need to Hold Back Your Digital Transformation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
What exactly does it take to become data-driven, and why is it so important in today’s digital environment? What practical steps can an enterprise take to make data fundamental to its mindset and practices? What is the connection between data and that other priority of the digital age—business and technical agility? Hear how companies are using data to drive their businesses and connect the dots between becoming data-driven and agility, digital transformation, and continuous innovation. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Data-driven Enterprise

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Chris Thomas, Managing Director, Technology and Innovation, Moody’s Analytics Accelerator
additionalFields.description:
One of the hardest things to get right after an acquisition is integrating the two company’s technologies. That’s precisely what Chris Thomas, Managing Director of Technology and Innovation in the Moody’s Analytics Accelerator did after Moody’s acquired REIS, a U.S. commercial real estate data provider. As the technology lead of Moody’s Analytics Accelerator, Thomas’s role is to support new product development and integration of acquisitions, making sure that technologies are aligned effectively. Jeff Drew from AWS spoke with Thomas about how REIS and the Moody’s Analytics Accelerator met their integration goals and what learnings were derived that could benefit future acquisitions. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Winning Hearts and Minds Strategy for Acquisition and Integration

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Harvard Business Review Analytic Services, sponsored by AWS
additionalFields.description:
The disruptions of 2020 have been a test for innovation capabilities. The organizations that seem to be handling this test best are those that let their customers drive their innovation efforts. They aim to solve their customers’ problems first, and that informs how they innovate. Learn more about what innovation leaders do differently in this survey of 585 business executives conducted by Harvard Business Review Analytic Services in association with AWS. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Delivering Customer-Focused Innovation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Ian Wilson, Vice President of Human Resources at AWS
additionalFields.description:
Sustaining harmony under normal circumstances isnít always easy, and the pandemic has made this even more challenging. Ian Wilson, Vice President of Human Resources at AWS, shares his approach on how to help employees navigate through the challenges and opportunities of working during this crisis. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Five Ways Leaders Can Promote Work-life Harmony During the Pandemic

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Sometimes even the smallest amount of wisdom from our peers can spark big thinking and inspire great change. Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist at AWS, shares a collection of insights from C-suite leaders on several topics related to leading change in today's enterprise, including developing leaders, dealing with failure, championing diversity, keeping up with technology, and staying inspired. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Leading Transformation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Jonathan Allen, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
A common leadership challenge is how to achieve consistency of action and commonality of judgement with everyone across the business. It's tempting to think that everyone starts a transformation journey at the same logical time and place, and it's easy to assume everyone understands the "why" and the "how" of that transformation. As AWS Enterprise Strategist Jonathan Allen explains, even leadership teams that are seemingly aligned never actually have the conversation to align properly and calmly on the why and the how in the clear contextual map of their world their business lives in. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: What Are Your Cloud Transformation Principles?

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Security has become everyone’s job, and its management has become a strategic concern of the enterprise. The way forward is for the enterprise to build a culture of security. AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz describes approaches he's used to establish awareness of risks and controls along with a set of norms and practices that align with keeping the enterprise secure.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Creating a Culture of Security

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Darren Hardman, VP and General Manager, AWS UK and Ireland
additionalFields.description:
The pressure to digitally transform is increasing, often resulting in a complex, multi-faceted change program. The need for business leaders to expertly drive this change throughout their organizations is critical to success. Darren Hardman, VP and General Manager of AWS UK & Ireland, offers his perspective on how executives can navigate the complexity and deliver the business and customer value they seek. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Leaders in the UK are driving transformation. Here’s how.

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Mark Schwartz, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
As we navigate the changes brought about by the digital revolution, we see the role of the enterprise CFO changing. In fact, the digital world requires us to think very differently about what a CFO does. In this ebook, AWS Enterprise Strategist Mark Schwartz compares the “old” and the “new” ways of defining what a CFO does in order to identify the traits of today's digital CFO. Though different CFOs and their enterprises have treated the role differently, it’s clear that the CFO has become central to driving the digital performance of the enterprise.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: How to Think Like a Digital CFO

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Klaus Bürg, Managing Director & General Manager, AWS DACH region
additionalFields.description:
With German enterprises struggling to maximize the opportunities presented by Digital Transformation, Klaus Bürg, Managing Director & General Manager, explores barriers to transformation and why breaking down these barriers is critical to remaining competitive.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Transforming German Enterprises for Competitive Advantage

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Christian Chevalier, Head of Sales, AWS France
additionalFields.description:
Successful digital transformation continues to challenge many French organizations. Christian Chevalier, Head of Sales, AWS France, shares his experiences for some of the more common pitfalls and how French leaders can avoid them.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Helping French Organizations Successfully Transform

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Julien Groues, Managing Director, AWS France
additionalFields.description:
Julien Groues, Managing Director, AWS France, discusses the critical need for the leaders of French organizations to drive digital transformation, laying the ground for a legacy that will be more far more influential and visionary than they could have ever imagined.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: French Leaders Must be the Drivers of Digital Transformation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Darren Hardman, VP and General Manager, AWS UK and Ireland
additionalFields.description:
With Cloud computing, the pervasive technology of the digital age, at the core of so many fast-growing UK business, Darren Hardman—VP, General Manager, UK and Ireland for AWS—investigates the impact of AWS on the UK. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Impact of AWS in the UK

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Morgan Reed, CIO, State of Arizona Enterprise Technology (ASET)
additionalFields.description:
Perspectives from AWS and leading enterprises on how organizations are transforming with the AWS Cloud.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Interview with Morgan Reed, CIO, Arizona

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Shaown Nandi, former CIO, Dow Jones
additionalFields.description:
Shaown Nandi, former CIO at Dow Jones, dives into how he and his team identify, develop, and inspire new leaders, the importance of diversity at Dow Jones, and his approach to encouraging mentorship. Shaown also explains why learning to fail keeps the business and employees on the forefront of new technology - as long as you fail in a smart way.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Leadership, Diversity, Learning to Fail, and Balancing Technolog‪y

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Mohamed Al Qaed, Chief Executive, Information and eGovernment Authority, Kingdom of Bahrain
additionalFields.description:
Perspectives from AWS and leading enterprises on how organizations are transforming with the AWS Cloud.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Interview with Mohamed Al Qaed, Chief Executive, Information and eGovernment Authority, Kingdom of Bahrain

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Charlie Ewen, Chief Information Officer, Met Office
additionalFields.description:
Charlie describes the talent strategy and leadership development program at Met Office, including the value of using exemplars as a mechanism for inspiring teams across vastly different functional domains. 

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Identifying and Selecting Future Leaders

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Mahmoud El-Assir, CIO, Verizon
additionalFields.description:
Perspectives from AWS and leading enterprises on how organizations are transforming with the AWS Cloud.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Interview with Mahmoud El-Assir, CIO, Verizon

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Perspectives from AWS and leading enterprises on how organizations are transforming with the AWS Cloud

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Inspirations

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Steve Day, Executive General Manager, Cloud & Infrastructure, National Australia Bank
additionalFields.description:
Perspectives from AWS and leading enterprises on how organizations are transforming with the AWS Cloud.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Interview with Steve Day, Executive General Manager, National Australia Bank

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Rob James, CIO, Qantas
additionalFields.description:
Rob James from Qantas shares his insights on cloud leadership and innovation.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Cloud Leadership and Innovation

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Hervé Coureil, Chief Digital Officer, Life Is On/Schneider Electric
additionalFields.description:
Hervé shares his thoughts on how to identify and nurture future leaders, ways to inspire teams to raise the bar, and the importance of transparency.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Interview with Hervé Coureil, Chief Digital Officer, Life Is On/Schneider Electric

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Steve Schmidt, Vice President and Chief Information Security Officer for AWS, interviews Emma Smith, Global Cyber Security Director for Vodafone.
additionalFields.description: Emma discusses security as a business enabler, the evolution of Vodafone's security organization, diversity and inclusion, and maintaining team culture in a virtual environment in episode two of AWS Verified.
additionalFields.headline: Global conversations with security leaders: Vodafone

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Bryan Landerman, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
A customer recently asked me how we introduced the concept of “failing forward” at Cox Automotive. It is a change many enterprises are working to implement, and it caused me to step back and reflect…How do you transition an organization’s culture to embrace failure?

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Failing & Creating a Culture of Learning

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Phil Potloff Head of Enterprise Strategy, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Application modernization is one of the big drivers of cloud adoption, with enterprises considering it as an opportunity to not just reduce operating costs as they move their core technology to the cloud, but also to improve performance, resiliency, and speed of delivery for new products and features.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Does Your Technology Organization Have a Nimbleness Metric?

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Kareen Boutonnat, Group COO, Lightsource BP
additionalFields.description:
Lightsource BP is a global market leader in the development, acquisition and long-term management of large-scale solar projects and smart energy solutions. Lightsource BP projects generate competitively-priced, dependable clean energy for businesses and communities. For Kareen Boutonnat, Group COO, the most exciting (and also the most challenging) task on her plate is ongoing globalization. Kareen shares her approaches for staying at the forefront of the rapidly changing renewable energy sector. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Building the Future

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
One of the things that I enjoy most about Amazon’s culture is that Customer Obsession is our first leadership principle. I was a customer for 26 years in my various roles at The Coca-Cola Company and benefited from Amazon’s customer obsession. What I found is this often comes down to creating, and constantly making better, great customer experiences. Cloud technology can massively shorten the time it takes to deliver innovative experiences with lower total costs, and AWS customers like GoDaddy and Anthem are doing this on a daily basis. Even so, delivering great experiences isn’t always easy—it requires balancing business priorities, creating internal mechanisms to inspire experimentation, and teams that embrace diverse thinking. Recently I had the opportunity to talk with two Chief Technology Officers—Charles Beadnall from GoDaddy and Ed Smith of Anthem—for our Conversations with Leaders series on AWS Executive Insights, to hear their insights about the benefits of cloud.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Creating Remarkable Customer Experiences: Priorities, Experimentation, and Inclusion

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Ed Smith, CTO, Anthem, Inc.
additionalFields.description:
Ed Smith, CTO of Anthem, Inc. sits down with Miriam McLemore of AWS, and shares insights on technology leadership, innovation, and leveraging data and cloud technology as enablers of optimal customer experiences.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Enablers of Optimal Customer Experiences

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Charles Beadnall, CTO, GoDaddy
additionalFields.description:
GoDaddy is empowering everyday entrepreneurs around the world by providing the help and tools to succeed online. With 19 million customers worldwide, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Recently, AWS Enterprise Strategist Miriam McLemore had the opportunity to sit down with GoDaddy CTO Charles Beadnall to talk about his experiences at the company, inspiring and driving innovation, and getting to the root of what customers really value.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Customer-centric Innovation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
There’s a disturbing trend in business today of shorter and shorter company lifespans: the average tenure of an S&P company today is a mere 15 years, compared to 67 years in the 1920s.Moreover, in the last 20 years the number of domestic companies on the US Stock Exchange has dropped by half. While there are a variety of reasons why companies are not reaching their golden years, I suspect that this trajectory will continue.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Future of Faster Enterprises

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Phil Potloff, Head of Enterprise Strategy, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Phil Potloff, Head of Enterprise Strategy at AWS, talks with Kylie Bonassi, Director of Brand Communication at ADAPT, about how any organisation can learn from startups on how to innovate. 

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: How to Think Like a Startup

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Having worked on digital transformation at a 130-year-old multinational company, Miriam is perfectly placed to show how much of a difference the right tech, people, and processes can make for enterprises. If a company of that age and scale can rationalise their tech and start reacting at the speed of a start-up, anyone can.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: The Future of Faster Enterprises

additionalFields.subHeadline: by The London School of Economics and Political Science
additionalFields.description:
Explore the benefits and impact of cloud as a 21st Century digital enabler. Research by the London School of Economics and Political Science, commissioned by AWS, indicates that cloud continues to reduce technology and organisational costs while boosting development productivity by a factor of five in many cases and enhancing ROI.  

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Transformative Effect of Cloud on Firm Productivity and Performance

additionalFields.subHeadline: A Conversation with John Sullivan, CIO and Project Director, Virgin Trains
additionalFields.description:
John Sullivan, CIO and Project Director at Virgin Trains, describes the power of automation and a focus on customer experience.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Empowering Innovation at Virgin Trains

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with Darren Mowry, Managing Director, EMEA Sales (Acceleration and Expansion), AWS
additionalFields.description:
Darren shares some insight on our ways of working at AWS and the wider Amazon family. He details how we got to where we are by sticking to our leadership principles, keeping things agile with two-pizza teams, and always working back from the customer.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: Creating an Innovation Culture

additionalFields.subHeadline: with Jonathan Allen, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
In this video, Jonathan Allen sets out the 12 steps to successfully scale your talent when moving to the cloud. One of the most important steps is upskilling existing employees, and Jonathan tells us how getting just 10% of your team certified could make a company-wide difference.

Watch now »
additionalFields.headline: How to Successfully Scale Your Talent Transformation

additionalFields.subHeadline: Perspectives from today's enterprise executives in the era of digitization
additionalFields.description:
As organizations undertake digital transformation efforts, they are turning to cloud services to deliver applications at an accelerated pace. IDC spoke with organizations that run a variety of business applications on the AWS serverless platform and found that serverless helps them drive business value in four fundamental areas, summarized in this infographic.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Generating Business Value with the AWS Serverless Platform

additionalFields.subHeadline: Leverage cloud migration to deliver four areas of business value
additionalFields.description:
To help organizations quantify the business value of moving to the cloud, the AWS Cloud Value Framework was developed based on hundreds of customer business cases. Differing business requirements, industry needs, and leadership profiles have resulted in unique cloud adoption journeys for each of these organizations, but while the various paths to the cloud may be different, most business cases consist of a combination of four distinct areas of value.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Realizing Business Value with AWS

additionalFields.subHeadline: Examining the value Live Nation realized from migrating to the cloud
additionalFields.description:
Live Nation produces more concerts, sells more tickets, and connects more brands to music than anyone else in the world. Jake Burns, VP of Cloud Services for Live Nation, worked with the AWS Cloud Economics team to understand the value Live Nation realized from their migration to the cloud. Together, they identified four key areas of quantifiable business value.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: How Live Nation Realized Business Value with AWS

additionalFields.subHeadline: Chart a course for transformation to a data-driven enterprise
additionalFields.description: Increasingly, organizations will rely on cloud platforms to accelerate their transformation to a data-driven enterprise. Every company must move quickly to assess its data analytics capabilities and chart a course for transformation to a data-driven enterprise. It is a crucial part of becoming more responsive to customers and to market opportunities, and more agile given the rapidly changing nature of technology and the marketplace. Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Power of the Data-Driven Enterprise

additionalFields.subHeadline: It will cost you less than you think to reskill and scale up your current staff
additionalFields.description:
One of the top concerns around migrating to the cloud is whether your existing teams have the skills needed to make it happen. The answer is simple: yes, they can—with the right training. In fact, research shows that it's less expensive to reskill and scale up your current staff than it is to hire new teams. Not only that, organizations that are comprehensively trained adopt cloud 80% faster on average. This infographic provides a quick snapshot of the steps you can take to set your teams up to succeed.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: A 10 Step Action Plan for Talent Transformation

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Venkat Venkatraman, Professor at Boston University and Amazon Web Services
additionalFields.description:
Many firms have already explored and executed some digital initiatives to date. You may be in the midst of your own plans. As a starting point, we invite you to take a quick look at the following six questions and see how many apply to your setting now. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Part 5: A Digital Diagnostic Discussion For Your Team

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Venkat Venkatraman, Professor at Boston University and Amazon Web Services
additionalFields.description:
Is the senior team truly behind the substance and significance of digital business reinvention beyond symbolic moves? We offer three guidelines.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Part 4: Three Essential Guidelines For Digital Reinvention

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Quint and Amazon Web Services
additionalFields.description:
This report co-authored by Quint Group and AWS examines the criticality of clear cloud sourcing strategies in delivering true digital transformation, regardless of whether your business strategy focuses on optimisation or growth.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Realizing the Value of Cloud Sourcing

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Venkat Venkatraman, Professor at Boston University and Amazon Web Services
additionalFields.description:
Conditions that support the status quo, inhibit change, favor incrementalism, and cause roadblocks—sometimes consciously, other times more implicitly—are the building blocks of failure.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Part 3: The Five Traps That Stall Digitalization

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Venkat Venkatraman, Professor at Boston University and Amazon Web Services
additionalFields.description:
Embracing digital is urgent and a sequenced portfolio of digital experiments is needed to learn and re-learn so the business can navigate the uncertainties ahead and transform successfully. 

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Part 2: Building the Digital Mindset

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Miriam McLemore, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Over the past few weeks, I’ve been sharing highlights from my conversations with seven leaders around their perspectives on innovation at scale when it comes to people and organization. Our dialogues with these leaders, from both commercial enterprises and the public sector, explore how these individuals cultivate next level leaders, how they deal with failure, and how they keep up with the ever increasing pace of technology. In this final video of the four-part series of interviews,these leaders share with me which other leaders have inspired them as they navigate their own career and lead their organizations through a cloud and digital transformation journey.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Staying Inspired: A Conversation with Today’s Enterprise Cloud Leaders

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Phil Potloff, Head of Enterprise Strategy, AWS
additionalFields.description:
One of the foundational steps that enterprises take as part of their journey to the cloud is establishing a Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE). The CCoE is a multi-disciplinary team that is assembled to implement the governance, best practices, training, and architecture needed for cloud adoption in a manner that provides repeatable patterns for the larger enterprise to follow. It might go without saying, but an effective CCoE requires both rock solid execution skills as well as creativity when endeavoring to create new cloud-based provisioning and delivery processes that don’t carry over the bureaucracy and limitations of their current operating model.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Challenging Conventional Wisdom About How to Build a Cloud Center of Excellence

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Jonathan Allen, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Many modern enterprises are a maelstrom of emotions, facts, opinions, and in many cases, outright competition both inside and outside of the organization. The bigger the business, the bigger the challenge for leaders to set and execute a common strategy. This is especially true when looking to reap the benefits of moving to Cloud. When you suddenly remove a huge amount of undifferentiated heavy lifting, pay attention to being customer-obsessed, and focus on the data and logic required of technology to deliver this end, some people are going to feel intimidated at best and hostile at worst for what this means to them personally. This FUD (fear, uncertainty, and doubt) can be magnified in the move to Cloud, because it cuts across so many paradigms and existing job roles.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Creating the Cloud Business Office

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Phil Potloff, Head of Enterprise Strategy, AWS
additionalFields.description:
In my last post, I promised a user’s guide to the Cloud Strategy Canvas. Although the canvas is meant to stand alone, it helps to have a few insider tips and techniques gained from experience. To ensure that this guide is rooted in Lean innovation best practices, I collaborated with expert strategy facilitator Matthew E. May to provide you with a cloud strategy process that is consistent with how fast-moving companies are developing their larger corporate and line of business strategies.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Cloud Strategy Canvas: A User’s Guide

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Jake Burns, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
Everyone who works in IT at Live Nation is familiar with the phrase “go faster than what is comfortable.” It was our CEO’s message to us when he called an IT leadership meeting in 2015 and shared his vision for how he wanted to modernize the company—a meeting that sparked a transformation of IT and gave me my mandate to get us out of the datacenter business by going all-in with AWS.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: How to Go Fast

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Jake Burns, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
A constraint is a limitation that’s placed upon us. In this post we’ll look at three different types of constraints—time constraints, resource constraints, and guardrails—and explore how each of them can be used to drive innovation, speed, and efficiency.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: The Power of Constraints

additionalFields.subHeadline: A conversation with  Colleen Camuccio, VP Program Management, Dow Jones
additionalFields.description:
Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile, and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest newsgathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Diving deep

additionalFields.subHeadline: by Jake Burns, Enterprise Strategist, AWS
additionalFields.description:
The world of traditional on-premises IT has become reasonably accurate at forecasting operating costs. We’ve been running IT in a very similar, familiar way for a long time, and we’ve become good at it. When adopting cloud, it can be helpful to reevaluate how we think about cost management, particularly around fixed-cost models and consumption-based services. Below are some ideas that have helped me be successful in this area.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: Continuous Optimization

additionalFields.subHeadline: Accelerating adoption of cloud services and infrastructure has resulted in a skills gap for IT professionals who are properly trained and certified to use the latest cloud environment.
additionalFields.description:
IT infrastructure transformation is happening. Enterprises are looking for efficiency and the desire to gain and keep the competitive advantage through faster innovation. Yet, there aren't enough IT professionals with the necessary expertise in the cloud. IT leaders are struggling to acquire the right talent that can help support their cloud initiatives, and high demand means there's market competition for cloud-skilled professionals. Learn why up-skilling your existing staff could save time and cost when compared with recruiting and training new staff.

Read more »
additionalFields.headline: How to Address the Cloud IT Skills Gap

additionalFields.subHeadline: Data is your differentiator
additionalFields.description:
Generative AI relies on data to create content. The better the input, the better the result.

additionalFields.headline: To Get the Most from Generative AI, Data is Your Differentiator
